title: Firefox download attempt from pushpad.xyz site detected and blocked by Kaspersky Premium
content:
Estou recebendo uma aviso de tentativa de download usando o firefox no site pushpad.xyz pelo meu antivirus Kaspersky Premium. Já desinstalei o Firefox, fiz uma varredura pelo meu computador com o antivirus, com Malwarebytes e nada foi encontrado. Porque o Firefox tem esta tentativa de download? Do que se trata? Tem como desativar isto?

I'm getting a notification of trying to download using firefox from the pushpad.xyz website by my Kaspersky Premium antivirus. I already uninstalled Firefox, I scanned my computer with antivirus, with Malwarebytes and nothing was found. Why does Firefox have this download attempt? What it is? Is there a way to disable this?
creator: nmega1

title: Star Wars Battlefront Companion Website Doesn't Sync Data
content:
Hello there!

I've been trying to troubleshoot the previously mentioned website: https://api.battlefront.dice.se because it will not properly sync in data from the base PC / Console game.

I opened up the browser console tool on the section that's having issues and found multiple error messages (some of which I attached below) as well as a large amounts of warnings. (select ones also attached below.) There are also more warnings of various kinds when I enter web dev tools and look at console.

I have a friend with an old 4th generation iPad and he was able to get the sync to work successfully, so my guess is it has some scripts that modern browsers / operating systems think are "unsafe" and won't allow them to process. I've tried using older versions of Firefox but that didn't fix the problem. My question is does anyone know of a way I can "fix" the website so that it will have full functionality again or alternatively is there a way to bypass those measures and allow the website to work as intended?

Please let me know if you can help or need more information and thanks in advance!
creator: Gengarbarian

creator: schmegs

title: Can't Block Autoplay
content:
I've blocked Autoplay (Audio & Video) for *all* Web sites via the settings menu, but videos still continue to play automatically (abcnews.go.com, for instance).

I went to config:about, and made all the suggested changes I found in Mozilla support. Autoplay seems to be blocked now, but at the expense of Firefox going into an endless loop trying to load and play videos. While in this loop, Firefox is eating up 20% of my CPU sources, which comes to close to making my PC unusable.

I have Firefox 109.0.1, 64-bit.

This has been a chronic problem ever since I've used Firefox. Someone needs to take a MUCH deeper dive into why we can't block autoplay.
creator: upom123

title: Usernamedrop down menu not working
content:
Firefox used to save the entered usernames regardless of whether you saved the password as well. When they did the major update a couple of years ago (might have been 2020 but I think it was early 2021) and introduced the new login manager, that list stopped working and I had to type out the entire username every single time. It suddenly started working again last year and now I'm setting up a new laptop and once again, Firefox will not save the username in a dropdown menu. I use a particular website that has well over 100 different usernames for work that I do and having to type out the whole username every time I log in (I'm logging in and out upwards of 50 times a day in the spring each year) is a huge time waster over the course of a workday.

There must be some sort of setting change that can be done or patch to make the username box behave like the old Firefox. I do NOT want passwords to be saved on this site (it contains personal info for over 1000 people) but do want the username saved so all I have to do is type a portion of the username and it pulls it out of the menu. For example, it could have a username of firefox23 or firefox112 and all I have to do is type in 23 or 112 and it pulls up the rest of the username I need out of the dropdown menu.

creator: hector__garcia

title: Horribly inaccessible
content:
Why is there no option to change the global font within the browser? Why does it ignore my computer's 125% scaling? Unless I'm simply missing an option, this browser is horribly inaccessible and its honestly upsetting. Not everyone can function with a toolbar at 10 pt font. I can't, and I need a browser that cares enough to let me change it. I stopped using Firefox a nearly a decade ago as my vision became more of a barrier. When I decided to switch from Edge to a different browser, my partner recommended I try Firefox again. Still horrible.

I know there are some fancy workarounds I've seen people use, but the fact you don't have any native accessibility settings is ableist, as not all disabled users are also coders. Do better, Mozilla.
creator: tomballartgirl

title: Can't do more than one search on Metacritic; probably bad cookie
content:
Starting this week, I can do only one search for a movie title on Metacritic.com. I get a 403 error from any attempt to do a subsequent search. I can get one more successful search if I first delete my Metacritic cookies from Firefox. But the problem repeats after any successful search.

Repeated searches work fine if I access Metacritic via Chrome. In case it matters, I'm running both browsers under Windows 10 on a desktop.

Can I tell Firefox not to accept cookies from Metacritic? Other ideas?

title: Where are my Bookmarks and extension files now? I CRY :(( I was so stupid....Had two times firefox installation on my Mac
content:
Hello,

I am so stupid. I had a brand new Mac in November, and sadly accidentially installed firefox twice withouth knowing.

(once installed in Programms once installed on my Desktop, because I was not used to the Mac Installation method with dragging simply the file and not to choose installation directory)

Today I wanted to clean my desktop a little so i moved every icon to wherever it needed to be. I moved also firefox to - Programms on mac and it asked me if i want to keep both - i clicked yes.

Sadly now I have FireFox and Firefox Copy in my Programmfiles but my Firefox bookmakrs and everything is missing now (Because, it was safed on the "firefox" that was "installed" on my Desktop. thats a big nightmare, because i make everyday bookmarks for my work and everything, now the firefox that is installed on the programms is not containing anything, every bookmark, every stored session (from tab session manager addon) is gone....

How can I get these bookmarks back? I dont have normaly overwritten something, I just need to know, how can I access these Bookmark files again? Why even are these things missing now, I just moved firefox Icon to the programm folders from my desktop...

I had the "firefox Account sync activated" now i logged in intoe the empty firefox but nothing has changed no bookmarks, no addon files I could cry for real so much work lost thats a nightmare...

If someone could help I sent money instantly...

title: How to disable or configure 3 fingers tap behavior
content:
Hi, I'm running Firefox 109 on Win11 on a recent lenovo laptop with touchpad gesture and I can't find the way to disable a 3 fingers tap behavior specific to firefox.

I want 3 fingers tap to only open link in a new tab (mouse middle click) witch is working fine and match win11 touchpad gesture setting.

But in firefox, when I'm not exactly on a link, the 3 fingers tap is giving me a round with 2 vertical narrows and a dot (see screenshot below), and then any touch on the touchpad is scrolling the page, really fast if swiping vertically, or slowly if swiping horizontally.

I can't find any about:config parameter about this behavior. I found a lot of discussion about 3 finger swipe on Mac computer but nothing specific to three finger tap and scroll (Like Here or Here)

If someone has any clue, or just the name of this function that I could look for it, I can't translate it right to find anything. Thanks a lot

title: Unable to launch Firefox profile from "/" directory in Ubuntu22
content:
OS - Ubuntu22 Firefox - Default firefox on ubuntu22 (Mozilla Firefox 103.0.1)

Use case - 1. Custom profile folder (named prof1) contains pref.js and chrome folder with custom css file. 2. prof1 is created in -> "/customData/profiles/prof1" 3. The folder "/customData" has full rwx permissions and is owned by $USER (not by root)

Output -> 1. When launching firefox mentioning the profile -> "$ firefox --profile /customData/profiles/prof1"

The browser does not load, but there is an error box saying Profile Missing Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.


Questions -> 1. Is it possible to load firefox profile from root directory ? 2. If custom profile folder is created in "/home", then it is launching and working perfectly. How is this possible when the permissions and owner is same as the one in "/customData"
